DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : This study evaluate efficacy internet-based relapse prevention therapist support , compare face-to-face therapy employee assistance program . The design two-armed randomized control design , outcomes measure term change problematic alcohol use , well depression quality life . Method : Participants problematic alcohol use , initial evaluation consist five face-to-face session license psychologist alcohol collateral problem extensively assess , recommend treatment problematic alcohol use . Consenting participant randomize one two group : 1 . Internet deliver relapse prevention therapist support 2 . Face-to-face therapy . Outcomes alcohol use , depression quality life well information user satisfaction gather post treatment . Follow 3 , 6 12 month completion . Our hypothesis internet-based program therapist support face-to-face therapy equally effective reduce alcohol use ( non-inferiority ) .
DOC.brief_title: Internet-Based Relapse Prevention v Face Face Therapy Employee Assistance Program
DOC.criteria: Problematic alcohol use recommend psychotherapy assess psychologist . Inadequate Swedish language skills No Internet access Reading and/or write difficulty Major depression Current suicidal thought and/or plan Primary problematic drug use PTSDrelated problem Psychosis Cognitive disability
